question.text: At an incident a casualty has stopped breathing. You should

explanation.text: Unblocking the airway and gently tilting the head back will help the casualty to breathe. They’ll then be in the correct position if mouth-to-mouth resuscitation is required. Don’t move a casualty unless there’s further danger.

answer.text: keep the head tilted forwards as far as possible
remove anything that’s blocking the mouth
raise the legs to help with circulation
try to give the casualty something to drink
